title: Addis Ababa
summary: Addis Ababa ([adˈdis ˈabəba] (listen); Amharic: አዲስ አበባ, romanized: Ādīs Ābeba, lit. 'new flower'), also known as Finfinne[4] (lit. "natural spring"), is the capital and largest city of Ethiopia. It also serve as regional capital of Oromia.[5][6][7] According to the 2007 census, the city's population is estimated at 2,739,551 inhabitants.[2] A highly developed and important cultural, artistic and financial centre, Addis Ababa is a chartered city.[8]
